body.head: Iwan Knorr [pseud I. O. Armand] (born Mewe, Jan 3, 1853; died Frankfurt, Jan 22, 1916)

div.p: Iwan Knorr [pseud I. O. Armand] (born Mewe, Jan 3, 1853; died Frankfurt, Jan 22, 1916), German composer, studied with Reinecke (composition), Moscheles (piano), and Jadassohn (theory) at the Leizpig Conservatory; from 1874 he taught in Kharkiv, then from 1883 at the Hoch Conservatory, Frankfurt (piano, theory, history), where in 1908 he succeeded Bernhard Scholz as the Director. Among his pupils were Hans Pfitzner, Cyril Scott, Ernst Toch. and Reinhard Oppel.
There is no correspondence, or indeed, so far as is known, personal contact, between Knorr and Schenker.
